intro: Clidemia ossaeiformis, commonly known as the Hawaiian false flax, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain areas.
